thread.title: Look: David Ross says he's ending retirement for Globetrotters
thread.title_full: Look: David Ross says he's ending retirement for Globetrotters

title: Look: David Ross says he's ending retirement for Globetrotters
text:
Look: David Ross says he's ending retirement for Globetrotters Former MLB catcher David Ross is coming out of retirement, but in a different sport. 
Chicago Cubs World Series hero David Ross is coming out of retirement. 
But just to play basketball with the Harlem Globetrotters for one night. 
The ex-catcher tweeted a picture of himself in a Globetrotters uniform, and said that he would be playing when the team has an event in Tallahassee, Fla. on March 1. 
Coming out of retirement for the night! March 1 in Tallahassee. Come check out my new team @Globies pic.twitter.com/1bkf0zslWe â€” David Ross (@D_Ross3) February 22, 2017 
Ross was born in Bainbridge, Ga., but he attened high school in Tallahassee. The former Cubs player retired after 15 seasons in MLB. He came off the bench and homered in Game 7 of team's historic World Series victory over the Cleveland Indians. 
The Chicago fan favorite will serve as an MLB analyst with ESPN this upcoming season. That's if the Globetrotters don't convince him to stay of course. Author
